recipe.name: Gum's Berry And Apple Pie
recipe.notes: Gum always made this for us when we'd come visiting.  She used a ceramic blackbird poking through the center  of the crust to  keep it from collapsing in on itself overly much and to work as a vent.  The little bastards are  hard to find, but well worth the  effort -- the pie wouldn't look the same without the little head peeping out. This being said, my crust generally falls in but its still tasty.
recipe.preparation: Pare, slice and cook apples in near-boiling water until soft but not mashed--about 10 mins.Drain apples and mix with boysenberries and sugar until evenly mixed.  Cover with with the dough disc and bake 35 to 45 minutes: 10 minutes at 450F for 10 minutes then step down to 350F.
